Package ca.corefacility.gview.layout.sequence

Provides for methods to use to layout and position any items along the sequence, and dividing up the map into different slots.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Backbone
    Backbone stores the actual shape of the backbone, and how items should "wrap" themselves around backbone.
    SequencePath
    Allows drawing of arbitrary shapes along the Sequence.
    SlotPath
    Builds a general path by transforming the sequence-specific coords, to coords on the screen in an appropriate slot.
    SlotRegion
    Provides access to objects that can layout shapes on certain regions.
    SlotTranslator
    Used to access the thicknesses/heights of slots from the backbone.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractBackbone  
    AbstractSequencePath  
    AbstractSlotRegion  
    BaseRange  
    HeightRange
    Defines a range in terms of height coordinates on the sequence.
    LayoutFactory
    Provides for a way to construct a particular Layout.
    LocationConverter
    Allows conversions from constant locations (such as full) to actual locations.
    RulerLabelThicknessCalculator
    Determines the maximum thickness of any given ruler label.
    ScaleCalculator
    Used to determine scale transisions for labels (dependent on the layout).
    SequenceRectangle
    Defines a rectangle in terms of sequence coordinates (BaseRange, HeightRange)
    SlotPathImp  
    SlotTranslatorImp  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Backbone.ShiftDirection  
    SequencePath.Orientation
    Defines the orientation of particular lines along the path, used for some effects.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ZoomException  

Package ca.corefacility.gview.layout.sequence Description

Provides for methods to use to layout and position any items along the sequence, and dividing up the map into different slots.

Implementing classes here can be used to create a new layout. The important classes here are Backbone, SequencePath, LayoutFactory, and SlotRegion.

Backbone is used to provide a way to translate points from cartesian coordinates (x,y) to coordinates on a sequence (base, height from center backbone ribbon).

SequencePath is used to translate not just points, but curves from cartesian coordinates to sequence coordinates. It is styled similar to the Java Path2D. It constructs curves out of segments provided gview.layout.prototype.segments. These segments store the curve in terms of sequence coordinates, so that when zooming, a new "stretched" curve can be constructed.

SlotRegion is simply used to store and provide access to all the layout-specific objects. It is created with a LayoutFactory implementation.

LayoutFactory is used to construct all the objects for a particular layout. It will construct the Backbone object, as well as the SequencePath objects.

Package Specification
